author: Pittsburgh News, Sports, & More
title: Japan's Mount Fuji snowless for longest time ever | TribLIVE.com
text: Japan's Mount Fuji snowless for longest time ever For the longest time on record, Japan‚Äôs Mount Fuji has been without snow. As of Halloween, the country‚Äôs tallest mountain was still without snow. This marks the longest period on record, The Weather Channel reported. The volcano‚Äôs snowcap begins forming on Oct. 2 on average, The Guardian said . Last year, snow was first detected there on Oct. 5. Japan saw warmer than average temperatures in September and October, The Weather Channel said. The country had its joint hottest summer on record this year with temperatures between June and August being 1.76C (3.1F) higher than an average, BBC News reported. ‚ÄúIn September, temperatures continued to be warmer than expected as the sub-tropical jet stream‚Äôs more northerly position allowed a warmer southerly flow of air over Japan,‚Äù BBC News said. ‚ÄúOctober has seen the heat ease slightly, but it has still been a warmer than average month.‚Äù Yutaka Katsuta, a forecaster at Kofu Local Meteorological Office, said comparative data became available in 1894, and this year beats the previous record of Oct. 26 ‚Äì which had been recorded twice, in 1955 and 2016, according to The Guardian. He said climate change might have a degree of impact on the delay in the snowcap‚Äôs formation. Fewer climbers tackled Mount Fuji this year, according to The Guardian, after Japanese authorities introduced an entry fee and a daily cap on numbers to fight overtourism. Mount Fuji last erupted about 300 years ago, and it was has been immortalized in countless artworks, including Hokusai‚Äôs ‚ÄúGreat Wave,‚Äù The Guardian said. Megan Swift is a TribLive reporter covering trending news in Western Pennsylvania. A Murrysville native, she joined the Trib full time in 2023 after serving as editor-in-chief of The Daily Collegian at Penn State. She previously worked as a Jim Borden Scholarship intern at the Trib for three summers. She can be reached at mswift@triblive.com. Remove the ads from your TribLIVE reading experience but still support the journalists who create the content with TribLIVE Ad-Free.

author: Ra√ºl Bruna
title: L‚ÄôONU denuncia greus abusos a Cisjord√†nia | Ra√ºl Bruna | Barcelona | Pol√≠tica | El Punt Avui
text: Conflicte B√®l¬∑lic al Pr√≤xim Orient L‚ÄôONU denuncia greus abusos a Cisjord√†nia Nacions Unides (ONU) va reclamar ahir a Israel que acabi amb els ‚Äúassassinats il¬∑legals i la viol√®ncia dels colons contra la poblaci√≥ palestina‚Äù als territoris ocupats. L‚ÄôOficina de Drets Humans de l‚ÄôONU va presentar un informe que denuncia greus abusos per part de les forces de seguretat i els colons israelians, entre els quals ‚Äúdetencions il¬∑legals i maltractament de detinguts‚Äù. L‚Äôalt comissionat per als Drets Humans, Volker T√ºrk, va alertar del ‚Äúr√†pid deteriorament de la situaci√≥ dels drets humans a la Cisjord√†nia‚Äù i va demanar a Israel que ‚Äúaturi immediatament‚Äù l‚Äô√∫s de t√†ctiques i armament militar ‚Äúen contextos d‚Äôaplicaci√≥ de la llei‚Äù. ‚ÄúL‚Äô√∫s de for√ßa innecess√†ria o desproporcionada i l‚Äôaplicaci√≥ de restriccions de moviment √†mplies, arbitr√†ries i discriminat√≤ries que afecten els palestins s√≥n extremadament preocupants‚Äù, va afegir T√ºrk sobre les conclusions de l‚Äôinforme. El document certifica que entre el 7 d‚Äôoctubre i el 27 d‚Äôoctubre han mort tres-cents palestins a Cisjord√†nia, inclosa Jerusalem Est, dels quals setanta-nou eren nens. Segons l‚Äôalt comissionat, les violacions documentades ara repeteixen el patr√≥ d‚Äôaltres den√∫ncies durant la ‚Äúllarga ocupaci√≥ israeliana de Cisjord√†nia‚Äù, per√≤ ‚Äúla intensitat de la viol√®ncia i la repressi√≥ actuals no s‚Äôhavia vist en anys‚Äù. Israel va reaccionar a l‚Äôinforme qualificant-lo de ‚Äúbastant rid√≠cul‚Äù, en paraules Tal Heinrich, portaveu de l‚Äôoficina del primer ministre. Heinrich va criticar que el document no t√© en compte les amenaces a les que s‚Äôexposen les seves forces de seguretat a l‚Äôhora de ‚Äúmantenir aquest front tan tranquil com sigui possible‚Äù. Cisjord√†nia ha viscut aquest 2023 l‚Äôany m√©s violent en dues d√®cades, amb m√©s de mig miler de palestins morts en xocs amb tropes i atacants israelians. Ahir mateix, un jove palest√≠ va perdre la vida durant una operaci√≥ de l‚Äôex√®rcit a Ramal¬∑l√†, on catorze persones m√©s van resultar ferides al centre de la ciutat. De la part israeliana, aquest any han perdut la vida 41 persones, la majoria colons. author: Petir Garda Bhwana
title: 2 Dead, 300 Hospitalized due to Heatwave in France
text:
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Two people have died and more than 300 others have been hospitalized across France due to illnesses caused by the heatwave, according to Minister of Ecological Transition Agnes Pannier-Runacher on Wednesday.
"More than 300 people were brought to hospitals through emergency services across France due to the hot weather. Two people even lost their lives due to illnesses caused by the heat," Pannier-Runacher said during a press conference.
Earlier on the same day, French Health Minister Catherine Vautrin said the number of emergency service calls had drastically increased after the temperature peaked on Tuesday, July 1, 2025.
"Yesterday, we observed an increase in the number of emergency service calls for medical assistance in the Ile-de-France region by 15 percent, this is a serious increase," Vautrin told RMC radio.
Meanwhile, the national meteorological agency, Meteo France, placed four departments on maximum-level red alert.
In Paris, the heatwave alert level was downgraded to orange, one level before the maximum, which was also applied in 55 departments, or two-thirds of the French territory.
In the southern region of Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, 8,000 households were left without electricity after underground infrastructure became too hot and caused outages, as reported by BFMTV citing energy network operator Enedis.
Medical journal Lancet published a study in 2023 that identified Paris as the most deadly capital in Europe during a heatwave, with an average of 400 heat-related deaths every year.
Editor's Choice: How Heatwaves Impact the Economies Across Europe

author: Christina Drury
title: 13 Illegal Interview Questions Hiring Managers Still Try To Ask
text:
13 Illegal Interview Questions Hiring Managers Still Try To Ask
Interviews can be nerve-wracking. But what do you do when an employer asks you a very personal ‚Äî and illegal ‚Äî question?
It may be 2024, but some companies are still stuck in the archaic ages. That means from time to time, they can ask questions that have long been deemed inappropriate, not to mention illegal. You do not have to answer these questions if they come up as they do not pertain to the job at hand.
A quick perusal of job boards shows that these illegal questions still tend to pop up during interviews.
1. Are You Married?
This question is mostly directed at women, though it has been asked of men, as well. Not only is it illegal to ask you about your marital status, your employer cannot ask if you are living with a domestic partner, either.
Simply put, your personal life ‚Äî including your dating life ‚Äî is nobody's business but your own and has zero impact on your ability to do your job.
2. Are You a US Citizen?
While you do need credentials to be able to legally work in the United States, you do not have to be a citizen. Employers will eventually be aware of your citizenship status, given that you have to pay taxes, but it's not something they can ask in an interview.
Additionally, an employer cannot ask you if your parents are citizens or variations thereof.
3. Are You (Do You Plan to Become) Pregnant?
One of the major concerns that may spark this question is whether a woman will leave when she has a baby. However, no matter if you are pregnant, wish to become pregnant, or don't plan to have children, this question doesn't belong in an interview.
If the hiring manager brings up the subject, you're well within your rights to say that it's a personal question between you and your family.
4. Have You Ever Been Arrested?
This question is a doozy, because while an employer can reject your application due to a criminal history, an arrest or even spending a night in jail does not equate to guilt.
Sometimes people are erroneously arrested based on false information and some have spent a night in jail without being charged. That's why it's important to have all of the facts and why only convictions should count against you.
5. Have You Been Injured on the Job Before?
Every employer wants to mitigate risk, but asking someone if they've suffered an injury in the workplace before is unacceptable. Even if you were injured, that should not play into whether or not you get a job with someone else.
You do not have to disclose this to any prospective employer and can ignore the question if asked.
6. Are You a Republican or Democrat?
An employer cannot ask you what your political affiliation is if it does not pertain to the job. This is considered a form of discrimination. They don't need to know who you voted or plan to vote for, nor do they need to know your take on any specific hot-button issues.
With political tensions as escalated as they are, it's a good idea to redirect the conversation, or politely refuse to answer.
7. Are You Disabled?
While there are certain disabilities that can impact your ability to do a job, employers cannot come right out and ask if you're disabled. That is your choice to disclose when and if necessary. An employer also cannot ask if you are taking any medications or about your mental health.
If you do decide to disclose a disability, your employer is within their rights to ask what they can do to help you overcome it in the workplace.
8. What Is Your Financial Standing?
Some positions, such as those dealing with handling money or sensitive information, require someone to be in good financial standing and have a good credit score. However, it's not okay for a hiring manager to ask you personally what your financial standing is like.
Your credit score, with rare exceptions, and the amount of money or assets you own is nobody's business but yours.
9. What Religion Are You?
This is seemingly another way to discriminate against prospective employees, by asking them what religion they are. It's also illegal.
It's nobody's business whether you are Catholic, Christian, Muslim, Jewish, or one of many other religions. Unless you're working with a specific type of organization, you can remain mum on this one.
10. Do You Have Childcare?
This is another personal question that seems to come up from time to time. Employers want to know who watches your children to generally get an idea of how reliable the childcare aspect is.
The concern is that you'll miss time at work because you have nobody to watch your children, and time is money. Regardless of how innocuous this question may seem, it's illegal to ask.
11. Any Genetic or Physical Characteristics
Other questions among those that are illegal include inquiries into your weight, age, gender, sexual orientation, race, or nationality. In a private questionnaire, you have the opportunity to disclose some of those variables, but they cannot be brought up during an interview.
These types of questions can be viewed as discriminatory, especially if they were to keep you from getting a position you're otherwise qualified for.
12. How Old Are You?
For most people, their age has no bearing on their abilities, but some employers tend to want to hire younger or older, depending on their company values and needs.
This question could actually be disguised as another question, such as what year were you born? How old are your children, or even, do you have any grandchildren? All variations of asking for your age are illegal and you do not have to answer.
13. Where Do You Live?
Unless you are required to live within a specific distance of your job ‚Äî such as if you're on a local police force or you work in a government capacity in a region ‚Äî employers are not entitled to know anything about your living situation.
This also goes for whether you rent or own, or what you pay per month for your home.

author: Tanja Banner
title: Zweite Erde? Hoffnungen um potenziellen Erdzwilling Trappist-1 d werden entt√§uscht
text:
Zweite Erde? Hoffnungen um potenziellen Erdzwilling Trappist-1 d werden entt√§uscht
Die Suche nach einer zweiten Erde konzentrierte sich auf das Trappist-1-System. Nun zeigen neue Daten des ‚ÄûJames Webb‚Äú-Teleskops ein unerwartetes Ergebnis.
Montr√©al ‚Äì Wenn es um Planeten au√üerhalb unseres Sonnensystems geht, auf denen es m√∂glicherweise Leben geben k√∂nnte, dann f√§llt immer ein Name: ‚ÄûTrappist-1‚Äú. Dabei handelt es sich um einen roten Zwergstern, der nur etwa 40 Lichtjahre von der Erde entfernt ist und von sieben Planeten umkreist wird, die etwa erdgro√ü sind. Mehrere dieser Planeten befinden sich in der sogenannten ‚Äûhabitablen Zone‚Äú des Sterns ‚Äì das hei√üt, auf ihnen herrschen Temperaturen, die fl√ºssiges Wasser an der Oberfl√§che m√∂glich machen.
Deshalb gilt das ‚ÄûTrappist-1‚Äú-System als die gr√∂√üte Hoffnung bei Forschenden, eine ‚Äûzweite Erde‚Äú im Universum zu finden. Seit das ‚ÄûJames Webb‚Äú-Weltraumteleskop aktiv ist, kann die Forschungsgemeinschaft die ‚ÄûTrappist-1‚Äú-Planeten genauer untersuchen und mehr √ºber sie herausfinden. Dabei steht vor allem eine Frage im Vordergrund: Haben die Planeten in der habitablen Zone Atmosph√§ren?
Suche nach einer zweiten Erde: Der Exoplanet Trappist-1 d ist es wohl nicht
‚ÄûLetztendlich m√∂chten wir wissen, ob es irgendwo anders etwas √Ñhnliches wie die Umwelt gibt, die wir auf der Erde genie√üen, und unter welchen Bedingungen dies m√∂glich ist‚Äú, sagt Caroline Piaulet-Ghorayeb (University of Chicago und Universit√© de Montr√©al in einer Nasa-Mitteilung. ‚ÄûW√§hrend das ‚ÄöJames Webb‚Äò-Weltraumteleskop der Nasa uns erstmals die M√∂glichkeit gibt, diese Frage bei erd√§hnlichen Planeten zu untersuchen, k√∂nnen wir Trappist-1 d zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt von der Liste potenzieller Erdzwillinge oder -cousins ausschlie√üen.‚Äú Die Forschungsergebnisse wurden im Fachmagazin The Astrophysical Journal ver√∂ffentlicht.
Der Planet Trappist-1 d ist aus der Sicht des Sterns der dritte Planet und befindet sich am Rand der habitablen Zone. Er ben√∂tigt nur vier Erdtage, um den Stern einmal zu umrunden. Mithilfe des NIRSpec-Instruments des Weltraumteleskops hat das Forschungsteam nach Molek√ºlen Ausschau gehalten, die in der Erdatmosph√§re vorkommen ‚Äì beispielsweise Wasser, Methan oder Kohlendioxid. Gefunden wurden jedoch keine.
‚ÄûWebb‚Äú-Teleskop entdeckt keine Atmosph√§re bei Trappist-1 d
F√ºr das Forschungsteam gibt es verschiedene Gr√ºnde, warum um Trappist-1 d keine Atmosph√§re entdeckt wurde, wie Piaulet-Ghorayeb erkl√§rt: ‚ÄûEr k√∂nnte eine extrem d√ºnne Atmosph√§re haben, die schwer zu erkennen ist, √§hnlich wie auf dem Mars. Alternativ k√∂nnte es sehr dichte Wolken in gro√üer H√∂he geben, die unsere Erkennung bestimmter atmosph√§rischer Signaturen blockieren ‚Äì eher wie auf der Venus. Oder es k√∂nnte sich um einen kargen Felsen ohne jegliche Atmosph√§re handeln.‚Äú
Allerdings befindet sich Trappist-1 d auch in einem Umfeld, das es schwer macht, eine Atmosph√§re dauerhaft zu halten: Rote Zwergsterne sind bekannt daf√ºr, dass sie sehr aktiv sind. Sie schleudern h√§ufig Materie und hochenergetische Strahlung ins Weltall, die die Atmosph√§re von kleinen Planeten wegrei√üen kann ‚Äì vor allem, wenn die Planeten sich nahe an dem Stern befinden, wie es Trappist-1 d tut. Rote Zwergsterne sind jedoch auch die am h√§ufigsten vorkommenden Sterne in unserer Galaxie, weshalb die Forschung hofft, Planeten zu finden, die im Orbit um einen roten Zwerg ihre Atmosph√§re halten k√∂nnen.
Haben die anderen Trappist-1-Planeten vielleicht Atmosph√§ren?
‚ÄûWir stehen noch ganz am Anfang, wenn es darum geht, mit ‚ÄöWebb‚Äò nach Atmosph√§ren auf erd√§hnlichen Planeten zu suchen und die Grenze zwischen Planeten, die eine Atmosph√§re halten k√∂nnen, und solchen, die dies nicht k√∂nnen, zu definieren‚Äú, betont Co-Autor Bj√∂rn Benneke. Die Beobachtung der √§u√üeren ‚ÄûTrappist-1‚Äú-Planeten mit dem ‚ÄûWebb‚Äú-Teleskop l√§uft derzeit. Wie das Ergebnis aussehen k√∂nnte, ist noch unklar. Auf der einen Seite sind die Planeten e, f, g und h weiter vom Stern entfernt ‚Äì es k√∂nnte ihnen also etwas leichter fallen, ihre potenziellen Atmosph√§ren zu halten.
Durch ihre gr√∂√üere Entfernung vom Stern sind sie jedoch auch etwas k√ºhler, was es dem Weltraumteleskop schwerer macht, atmosph√§rische Signaturen aufzusp√ºren. ‚ÄûDie Hoffnung f√ºr die Atmosph√§ren der Trappist-1-Planeten ist noch nicht verloren‚Äú, muntert Piaulet-Ghorayeb auf. ‚ÄûAuch wenn wir auf Planet d keine deutlichen atmosph√§rischen Signaturen gefunden haben, besteht dennoch die M√∂glichkeit, dass die √§u√üeren Planeten viel Wasser und andere atmosph√§rische Komponenten enthalten.‚Äú (tab)

author: Sacha Mirzabegian
title: Paris Olympics 2024: Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson apologises for opening loss to Germany; Steph Catley; Zambia next game; women's football
text: 'So sorry': Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson apologises for horror loss to Germany Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson apologised for Australia's dismal opening clash in Paris , following the 3-0 drubbing at the hands of Germany . The 2016 Olympic champions thoroughly outclassed the Matildas, with Australia lucky to walk away with only three goals conceded after Germany's strikers failed to convert on several chances. Germany led 2-0 at half time through headers off corners before Julie Brand tapped in a third in the 67th minute. READ MORE: Embarrassed coach gets reprieve by Dolphins as bizarre saga is brought to an end READ MORE: Matildas mortally wounded in brutal 3-0 defeat as Germany flexes in Paris READ MORE: Argentina coach slams chaotic 'scandal' in Olympic football loss to Morocco With the opening loss to their campaign, Australia needs to defeat Zambia on Monday morning to keep their Olympic dream alive. Speaking to media after the match, Gustavsson did not shy away from the task ahead, while delivering a message to the fans who woke up early to catch the match. "I just want to say I'm so sorry to let down the fans back home that put their alarms on a 3am in the morning to get up and support us. "It's just amazing to see the support back home and I know we disappointed a lot of people. Matildas star Steph Catley, who suffered a head knock in the first half, said the result was a wake up call for the 2023 World Cup semi-finalists, who will need to make adjustments to their set piece defence. "We have two more games and we have to turn it around quickly. We have a lot to learn from here," Catley said after the match. Watch every moment, every medal of the Olympic Games Paris 2024 live and free on Channel 9 and 9Now . Plus, every event streaming ad free, live and on demand with 4K on Stan Sport . "I think at times we were well on top and let two set pieces affect the game in a very negative way. There are things that we can fix nice and quickly, which is good ‚Äî but we just need to be better. "We conceded two set pieces. We are usually much, much better on set pieces. It is a wake-up call and it is not to our standard and we need to be better for the next game and turn this tournament around." Gustavsson assured fans back home his team will be better against Zambia at 3am on Sunday, saying the team will show its usual resolve in the next game. "The one thing I know about this team is that when they're backed against a corner and there's a lot of shit thrown at them with curve balls and different ways, a loss three-nil or baggage going missing ‚Ä¶ they never use these things as excuses. "This side is so physical normally, we win all the one-on-one duels, there's aggressiveness there, we're running and our speed beats teams. But it wasn't really there tonight."

author: MarketScreener
title: PT TIMAH Tbk : Collaboration with Karang Taruna Gemilang, PT Timah Plants - MarketScreener
text:
Collaboration with Karang Taruna Gemilang, PT Timah Plants 2500 Mangrove Trees on Nyiur Melambai Beach 19 July 2024 SHARE EAST BELITUNG - Mangroves play an important role in protecting coastal ecosystems, for this reason, PT Timah consistently preserves and plants mangroves in the company's operational areas.
Planting mangroves is also the company's effort to support the government's program towards Net Zero Emission.
In collaboration with Karang Taruna Gemilang, Lalang Village, East Belitung Regency, PT Timah planted 2500 mangrove trees in the Nyiur Melambai Beach Area, Lalang Village, Manggar District, East Belitung Regency, Thursday (18/07/2024).
Chairman of Karang Taruna Gemilang, Apriadi Nur Putra
grateful that this planting activity was carried out because this activity is one of the work programs of Karang Taruna Gemilang.
This mangrove planting also involves youth organizations in East Belitung.
"Today we are carrying out mangrove planting activities, and thank God the support from PT Timah is extraordinary in this activity. "Apart from that, this is also a program from Karang Taruna," he said.
The man who is often called Apri said that the aim of planting mangroves was to maintain the ecosystem in the Nyiur Melambai Beach environment.
This mangrove planting is also an effort to educate young people's love for the environment, especially protecting the mangrove ecosystem.
"In today's activity, we planted 2500 mangrove trees, involving Karang Taruna, Village Government, Regency Government, OPD and friends from Scouts," he said.
In the future, he hopes that the collaboration with PT Timah can continue because this mangrove planting area will be used as a location for small crab cultivation. So it can have an economic impact on society.
Meanwhile, the Head of the East Belitung Environmental Service, Novis Ezuar appreciated the activities carried out by Karang Taruna Gemilang together with PT Timah Tbk.
According to him, activities like this show that young people care about the environment.
"This activity also has a lot of communities and youth organizations involved, this shows that their concern for the environment has been ingrained from an early age, and this makes them play an active role in the future," said Novis.
According to him, PT Timah Tbk plays a very important role in supporting environmental management activities.
"So far, PT Timah's relationship with DLH itself has been quite good, especially PT Timah's activities in reclaiming ex-mining land, apart from that, PT Timah's social responsibility towards the environment is also very good," he said.
According to him, PT Timah has often been involved in tree planting activities not only in this place but also at several points in other areas.
"PT Timah is the largest BUMN in Bangka Belitung, so we hope that PT Timah can continue to play an active role in protecting the environment because with PT Timah's activities exploiting the environment, PT Timah also has a balance in protecting the environment," he said. (*)
Attachments

author: editorial@pulzo.com (Editorial Pulzo)
title: Alegr√≠a para due√±os de carros el√©ctricos por nuevos cargadores en Bogot√°; ser√°n gratuitos
text: Con una inversi√≥n que supera los 6.000 millones de pesos, la Secretar√≠a Distrital de Movilidad, La Rolita y Enel Colombia (a trav√©s de su l√≠nea Enel X) presentaron este 28 de diciembre la primera red de cargadores p√∫blicos para [veh√≠culos el√©ctricos](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/vehiculos-electricos), que estar√° compuesta por 15 electrolineras distribuidas en seis zonas. (Lea tambi√©n: [Carros avaluados en menos de $ 54 millones pagar√°n esta cifra (alta) en impuesto vehicular](https://www.pulzo.com/economia/impuesto-vehicular-colombia-2024-carros-pagaran-4-millones-por-precio-PP3348457)) El primer punto que se pone en servicio est√° ubicado en el barrio La Alhambra, en el parqueadero de la calle 114 A n√∫mero 45-98, donde se tienen disponibles tres terminales de carga r√°pida, con conectores CCS1, CCS2 y GBT, que tienen la capacidad de cargar una bater√≠a de 60 a 100 KW promedio en hora y media, llev√°ndola de 0 a 100 %. üöÄüí° El lanzamiento de nuestras estaciones de carga es un paso activo hacia la promoci√≥n de la movilidad sostenible en Bogot√°. üåøüöó [#ConectaConLaRolita] [pic.twitter.com/eyKAUIgce9] ‚Äî Movilidad Bogot√° (@SectorMovilidad) [December 28, 2023] El servicio ser√° gratuito durante los primeros 15 d√≠as y los usuarios tendr√°n una hora gratis de parqueo presentando el tiquete sellado al salir del estacionamiento, explic√≥ la gerente de la Operadora Distrital de Transporte La Rolita, Carolina Mart√≠nez. Puntos de carga p√∫blicos en Bogot√° para carros el√©ctricos Los otros puntos de carga, construidos en la carrera 10 n√∫mero 97-63, Modelia (calle 23f con carrera 75) y Nicol√°s de Federm√°n (calle 58¬™ Bis con kr.38), tambi√©n est√°n ubicados dentro de [parqueaderos](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/parqueaderos) del Distrito y entrar√°n en funcionamiento durante las pr√≥ximas semanas. De acuerdo con la secretaria de Movilidad, Deyanira √Åvila, quedan en construcci√≥n otros dos puntos en la Terminal de Transportes del Salitre, ubicada en la calle 22c N.68 f-34 y en San Andresito de la calle 9 con carrera 37a, los cuales ser√°n entregados en el primer semestre de 2024. [Ins√≥lito precio de los carros usados en Venezuela; cuestan m√°s que en Colombia](/carros/carros-usados-venezuela-cuestan-que-colombia-aveo-es-carisimo-PP3347909) [Atenci√≥n, conductores: Gobierno fij√≥ valores del impuesto vehicular para 2024](/economia/impuesto-carro-2024-colombia-gobierno-ajusto-precios-PP3346558A) [Cu√°nto vale una patineta el√©ctrica en Colombia y caracter√≠sticas a tener en cuenta](/economia/cuanto-vale-patineta-electrica-colombia-mas-barata-cuesta--21 -PP3346000A) [¬øSe puede viajar en carro el√©ctrico en Colombia? Conozca lo que necesita para hacerlo](/carros/carros-electricos-colombia-sirven-para-viajar-colombia-cuantos-kilometros-PP3346082) Para la definici√≥n de los puntos, la [Secretar√≠a de Movilidad](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/secretaria-de-movilidad) particip√≥ con el Gobierno Nacional en un proyecto de cooperaci√≥n t√©cnica con GIZ-Cooperaci√≥n Alemana Colombia para analizar las zonas con mayor potencial de demanda, teniendo en cuenta las matrices de generaci√≥n de viajes origen y destino. As√≠ mismo, se identificaron los puntos donde no hab√≠a estaciones de carga el√©ctrica y se priorizaron teniendo en cuenta los bienes de propiedad del Distrito que estuvieran disponibles, dijo √Åvila. Buenas noticias: [@SectorMovilidad], [@LaRolitaBog]y [@EnelColombia]nos hemos unido para implementar la primera red de cargadores p√∫blicos para carros el√©ctricos, un paso fundamental para avanzar hacia una movilidad m√°s sostenible, descarbonizada y amigable con el medio ambiente. [pic.twitter.com/HHGzM72JVx] ‚Äî Deyanira Avila (@Deyaniravilam) [December 28, 2023] Se estima que en la capital de pa√≠s hay 6.822 veh√≠culos el√©ctricos, seg√∫n el Registro Distrital Automotor de [Bogot√°](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/bogota), entre autom√≥viles, camionetas, motocicletas, camiones, buses, entre otros, que a partir de ahora contar√°n con una red de recarga p√∫blica de f√°cil acceso en toda la ciudad. LO √öLTIMO [Carros] Hace 1 hora [Alegr√≠a para due√±os de carros el√©ctricos por nuevos cargadores en Bogot√°; ser√°n gratuitos](/carros/carros-electricos-e-hibridos-bogota-tienen-nuevos-cargadores-publicos-gratis-PP3348947) [Carros] Hace 6 horas [Ins√≥lito precio de los carros usados en Venezuela; cuestan m√°s que en Colombia](/carros/carros-usados-venezuela-cuestan-que-colombia-aveo-es-carisimo-PP3347909) [Carros]

author: James Whitbrook
title: 50 Most Memorable Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and Horror TV Moments of 2023
text:
With a dizzying array of streaming services available, there was no shortage of great TV this year‚Äîand while io9 has already shared our top 20 shows of 2023, today we‚Äôre revealing our top TV moments‚Ä¶ all 50 of them. These are the moments when we laughed, cheered, shed a tear, shrieked in disbelief, and/or realized we were witnessing game-changing turning points, for better and sometimes worse .
Twisted Metal: The Opening Photo: Skip Bolen/Peacock In most shows, the ending is the best part. For Twisted Metal , the ending is certainly great, but it‚Äôs the show‚Äôs opening, a high octane action set piece directly giving the feel of the game itself, that sucks you in and sets you up for the rest of the series.
The Righteous Gemstones: Apocalypse Now Photo: Jake Giles Netter/HBO The season three finale of the dark religious comedy went from hilarious with Baby Billy‚Äôs Bible Bonkers and Walton Goggins hosting his Family Feud-style show to a full-on start of the apocalypse, complete with locust plague cliffhanger. We‚Äôre excited to see more supernatural shenanigans on the Danny McBride-led series.
Good Omens: The Kiss Photo: Cian Oba-Smith/Prime Video Season one of Good Omens established the long-standing‚Äîlike, since the beginning of time itself‚Äîfriendship between the demon Crowley (David Tennant) and the angel Aziraphale (Michael Sheen), but fans couldn‚Äôt help hoping that the crackling chemistry between them meant their relationship went deeper. Season two saw the pair tackling a mystery revolving around multiple romantic quandaries, including their own‚Ä¶ and ended with the passionate liplock Good Omens devotees have been pining for, only to see the ‚Äúineffable husbands‚Äù forced apart (cliffhanger alert!) due to celestial circumstances.
The Mandalorian: Grogu‚Äôs Ride Image: Lucasfilm Grogu gets his very own vehicle? And it‚Äôs the hollowed-out remains of IG-12? Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes.
Bluey: Muffin‚Äôs Granny Haggling Screenshot: Disney Jr./Disney+ A yard sale episode sees the return of Bluey and Bingo as the grannies, and adds onto the lore with Muffin getting her own alter-grannie persona. The iconic scarf, the position of power on the motorized scooter, and her haggling against a real crotchety grannie wins this episode with sheer comedic gold.
Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake: Marshall and Gary Image: Max While Fionna goes off on her adventures, we get a side-story with Marshall and Gary falling in love in their own little romantic comedy. We see their meet-cute over baked goods and their relationship develops with Gary encouraging Marshall to forge his own path in the face of his domineering mother. It‚Äôs so sweet.
Goosebumps: The Doppleganger Reveal Photo: Disney/David Astorga The horror in the new Goosebumps creatively subverted expectations for a YA show. In ‚ÄúGive Yourself Goosebumps,‚Äù seeing James and his doppelgangers explode into yellow goo when killed was so gross and funny.
Star Trek: Picard: Seven Sees Voyager Screenshot: Paramount+ Picard‚Äôs final season was understandably focused on its nostalgic hurrah to the cast of The Next Generation, but in a pitch-perfect moment it remembered it had a crewmate from another Trek show to honor as well. As the Titan circled the Fleet Museum‚Äôs collection of iconic ships of the line, Seven of Nine got to point out her home, the Voyager, the finest ship in Starfleet, to the young Jack Crusher, and pontificate on how far her family had seen her come in the years since. A perfect moment for Jeri Ryan, and a touching tribute to Star Trek: Voyager.
Dead Ringers: Twin Swap Photo: Niko Tavernise/Prime Video Prime Video‚Äôs Dead Ringers series, starring Rachel Weisz in a tour-de-force dual performance, made it clear it was exploring its own version of the story made famous by David Cronenberg‚Äôs 1988 cult medical horror tale. Still, it seemed inevitable that the series would have to lead to the same conclusion as the film, with the codependent twins dying side by side. Nope! In a shocking cap to its cleverly crafted story, Dead Ringers instead engineered the ultimate ‚Äútwin swap,‚Äù ending things on a note far more unsettling and eerily unresolved than Cronenberg‚Äôs gory full-stop.
Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch From Mercury: Eri Is Aerial Screenshot: Crunchyroll Gundam fans had long assumed that something dark was up with Witch From Mercury‚Äôs lead mobile suit, ever since little Ericht Samiya from the show‚Äôs prologue mysteriously vanished in the actual show. Glimpses here and there of a connection to Suletta and the Gundam Aerial flickered throughout the show‚Äôs first season, but it wasn‚Äôt until season two, in a moment of shock as the Aerial destroyed rival pilot Sophie, it was made explicit that Eri‚Äôs very soul was what drove the Aerial‚Äôs drone systems and the suit‚Äôs supernatural connection to Suletta. Truly, Gundam wanted to remind us it doesn‚Äôt mess around.
Scott Pilgrim Takes Off: Knives‚Äô Musical Moment Image: Netflix By sidelining its titular character, Scott Pilgrim Takes Off decides to offer deeper interior lives to nearly everyone in the primary cast of the hit graphic novel and film. Instead of being Scott‚Äôs high school girlfriend, Knives gradually comes into her own and is given a chance to figure out who she is outside of his orbit. As outlandish as the show is, watching Knives come to realize she‚Äôs got an affinity for the guitar is one of its most real moments‚Äîeven if you‚Äôve never picked up an instrument, a song has given a moment like this, from the colors to the feeling of realization that you‚Äôve just experienced something life-changing.
Rick and Morty: Rick vs. Rick Prime
Battle of the Ricks | Rick and Morty | adult swim This season‚Äôs Rick and Morty saw the smartest man in the universe confront his ultimate nemesis : a version of himself with the same level of genius but none, absolutely none, of the same heart. After a tech-fueled battle that could have gone either way, Rick ended up beating Rick Prime to death with just his angry, angry fists. Though he‚Äôd just achieved his greatest dream, the feeling was nowhere as cathartic as Rick thought it would be‚Äîand without that sense of closure, it‚Äôs something that‚Äôs clearly going to haunt him as the show progresses.
Secret Invasion: ‚Ä¶Super Skrull? Photo: Gareth Gatrell/Marvel It was awful , but it was also awfully memorable as Emila Clarke‚Äôs G‚Äôiah gained the power of every hero in the MCU , and then physically manifested a few of them.
What We Do in the Shadows: Guillermo‚Äôs Human Choice Photo: Russ Martin/FX What happens when a familiar who‚Äôs been trying to get his master to turn him into a vampire for years gets frustrated and takes matters into his own hands? For Guillermo (the always delightful Harvey Guill√©n) in the most recent season of What We Do in the Shadows, it meant a lot of terrified sneaking around once he realized Nandor (Kayvan Novak) is obligated to kill him for the betrayal. Plus, there were a lot of awkward physical blunders when it became clear his Van Helsing blood was making his body resist any kind of supernatural transformation. Ultimately, he had to admit the moral issues that come with being a bloodsucker were something he simply couldn‚Äôt get past‚Äîand in the season finale, he decided he‚Äôs better off staying human. It‚Äôll mean a whole new dynamic for Guillermo moving forward, and it‚Äôs one we can‚Äôt wait to see play out.
Star Trek: Lower Decks: The Promotion Image: Paramount+ It‚Äôs a small thing‚Äîa single pip added on their uniform collars, and a title change from Ensign to Lieutenant Jr. Grade. But Lower Decks opening its fourth season with this long-awaited recognition of how far its characters had come over the show was not just vital for that recognition, it also unlocked a season of stories that let the show push them in fascinating directions as they learned to grapple with even the slightest bit of new authority. In a show that had felt reticent to change too much in prior seasons, it was a moment for the show to begin closing one chapter and starting another.
Foundation: Cleon Gets Spaced Image: Apple TV+ Lee Pace‚Äôs Brother Day‚Äîthe smarmy, dangerously self-centered ruler of a galactic empire lorded over by a continuous cycle of clones‚Äîthought he was the most clever version of Emperor Cleon ever. But as we came to learn in Foundation season two , his actions were all engineered by Demerzel (Laura Birn), his android majordomo who‚Äôs really been running the show for centuries. That would have been satisfying enough, but to see the worst guy in the universe expire in the worst way possible‚Äìbeing spaced by people who‚Äôre tired of living under his thumb, and crumble away into frozen dust‚Äìwas a deliciously triumphant moment. Even the fact that Demerzel can just uncork another Cleon to fill his place doesn‚Äôt diminish it.
Doctor Who: The DoctorDonna Returns Screenshot: BBC/Disney+ The first of Doctor Who‚Äôs anniversary specials danced around the danger of Donna Noble remembering her time with the Doctor, but when it became necessary for the now 14th incarnation to unlock her memories, we got an incredible performance out of David Tennant and Catherine Tate, playing the drama and the grief of it all perfectly alongside the jubilation of Donna remembering just who she is, and who she‚Äôd become.
Wheel of Time: Egwene Strikes Back Photo: Jan Thijs/Prime Video Captured and enslaved by an invading kingdom that forces women with magical abilities to serve as weapons, the kind-hearted Egwene (Madeleine Madden) endures torture and humiliation, and her spirit teeters on the edge of breaking. As she fights to stay strong, her pain causes an internal shift that pushes her to inform Renna (Xelia Mendes-Jones), the woman who‚Äôs literally holding her leash, that she‚Äôs going to find a way to kill her‚Äîand then making good on that promise in Wheel of Time‚Äôs most emotional season two moment .
The Legend of Vox Machina: Grog Saying ‚ÄúFuck Shit Up‚Äù Image: Prime Video The Legend of Vox Machina is a show built on fan service for those who experienced the original actual play series. Whether you‚Äôre a longtime fan or just coming in, watching these moments play out can be extremely satisfying‚Äîso when Grog bellows out the words ‚Äúfuck shit up,‚Äù you know the show‚Äôs about to have some fun. It‚Äôs just five minutes of fist-pumping carnage as everyone in the party gets a moment to shine and look cool while beating (or shooting, stabbing, etc.) raiders to bits, and it‚Äôs fun as hell.
Blue Eye Samurai: The Ronin and the Bride
Blue Eye Samurai | The Ronin and the Bride | Official Clip | Netflix Blue Eye Samurai‚Äôs Mizu is complicated‚Äîthey have to be, as they‚Äôre a biracial woman living as a man in Edo-period Japan. As they‚Äôre slashing up a crime boss‚Äô foot soldiers during the fifth episode, we watch them live a peaceful, fairly idyllic life as a simple wife. It can‚Äôt last forever, obviously, and it‚Äôs a riot when things eventually break bad around her and they‚Äôre betrayed by their family. In a pretty great season overall, watching Mizu briefly give up their revenge quest and then go back to it because it‚Äôs all they‚Äôve ever known is devastating. Hell of a play, though.
One Piece: The Barrel Pledge Photo: Casey Crafford/Netflix Netflix‚Äôs One Piece adaptation largely shines thanks to the winning chemistry of the lead Straw Hat Pirates. Like in the anime and manga, they all play off each other very well, and it helps that Luffy (I√±aki Godoy) is so goofy and charming that it makes complete sense why the others would stay with him. So when the season finale ends with the gang declaring their dreams to one another (mixed with scenes from previous episodes where they‚Äôre played by younger actors), it really does feel like the true start of an adventure that longtime fans have experienced for years on end.
Castlevania: Nocturne: Olrox‚Äôs Backstory Image: Netflix Unlike its predecessor, Castlevania: Nocturne is more firmly rooted in real world history. The decision gives greater texture to its characters of color, in particular the Aztec vampire Olrox. Instead of being a one-note bloodsucker who simply killed Richter Belmont‚Äôs mother because that‚Äôs just what they do, he reveals himself to be a more complicated figure who wanted revenge for the lover Julia took from him. It‚Äôs an interesting intersection of race and queerness in a show that clearly has such things on its mind, and it makes him one of the more intriguing characters in the two-series franchise thus far.
Scavenger‚Äôs Reign: Levi‚Äôs Time-Lapse Image: Max Of all the characters in Max‚Äôs Scavengers Reign, it‚Äôs the helpful robot Levi who‚Äôs best equipped to survive its hostile alien world. Deeply curious about the world around them while still actively aware of the planet‚Äôs perils, Levi manages to fight off the season‚Äôs sort of Big Bad (a big tadpole/monkey thing dubbed ‚ÄúHollow) with the power of life. It‚Äôs not the first time we‚Äôve seen the meaning of life displayed like this, but it doesn‚Äôt take away from how stunning it is to watch. Like Scavengers Reign itself, the universe is mesmerizing, horrific, and disgusting all in one breath, and the overwhelming realization of that is what makes life worth living.
Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch From Mercury: Suletta Loses the Holder Title Screenshot: Crunchyroll The Witch from Mercury‚Äôs first season saw Suletta Mercury become one of the most prominent figures at her school and quickly work her way up the ranks by being incredibly in sync with her mech Aerial. Season two is all about bringing her to a low point, and that eventual turn is utterly devastating. It‚Äôs one thing for Guel to beat her thanks in part to Miorine and Suletta‚Äôs mom Prospera, it‚Äôs another to watch Suletta get her heart broken by her wife in front of the guy who just beat her. In a season where episodes ended at the worst possible time, this moment was a particular standout.
Monarch: Legacy of Monsters: Godzilla vs. Nuke Image: Apple TV+ Legendary‚Äôs Monsterverse has loved to reaffirm time and again the U.S. military has been right there alongside the growing threat of Titans throughout the years. More often than not, that military is just hopeless against the sheer might of big guys like Godzilla and Kong, and as Monarch: Legacy of Monsters shows, they‚Äôve made some stupid moves in the past.Their bright idea after using uranium to lure Godzilla to Bikini Atoll is to detonate a nuke in its face. That doesn‚Äôt work, obviously, but it‚Äôs hilarious (and extremely rude) to watch them try. With that information in mind, maybe Godzilla‚Äôs been right in wrecking up U.S. cities in the last few movies.
Scott Pilgrim Takes Off: The Musical Screenshot: Netflix Scott Pilgrim Takes Off had a lot of fun with the metacommentary in creating an allusion to the live-action adaptation within its own spin on the comics with the supposedly-Young-Neil-scripted Scott Pilgrim‚Äôs Precious Little Life adaptation of Scott‚Äôs, well, precious little life. But it couldn‚Äôt top the sheer, cheeky joy of Knives and Stephen pitching Matthew Patel himself into the starring role of a musical version‚Äîcomplete with its own jaunty spin on the first episode of the show, to boot.
Star Trek: Picard: Last Flight of the Enterprise-D Screenshot: Paramount+ Desperate times call for desperate measures, and when Picard and his friends found themselves in a race to stop the Borg Queen from turning Starfleet against itself, where could they go but to their old home? Preserved immaculately by Geordi LaForge, getting to see the Enterprise-D in all her glory, for one last battle helmed by her beloved bridge officers, set the stage for Picard‚Äôs fond farewell.
Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch From Mercury: Suletta and Miorine Reunite
Suletta and Miorine‚Äôs Reunion | Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch from Mercury Suletta and Miorine spent much of Witch From Mercury‚Äôs second season driven apart from each other, either by the growing tragedies of the narrative or more explicitly when Miorine tried to push Suletta away from her altogether in an attempt to keep her safe. True love can‚Äôt be kept apart for too long however, leading to Suletta‚Äôs fateful reunion with the woman she‚Äôd swore to protect, and one day wed, in one of the show‚Äôs most emotional moments.
Doctor Who: ‚ÄúHello, Old Soldier‚Äù Image: BBC Bernard Cribbins‚Äô death earlier this year was already a heartbreaking blow to Doctor Who fans, but the tears flowed freely once again when the actor‚Äôs final performance posthumously arrived in ‚ÄúWild Blue Yonder.‚Äù The Doctor‚Äôs elation at seeing an old friend again, and Cribbins, on fire as ever, hooting and hollering in Wilf‚Äôs wheelchair as he diligently waited for his granddaughter to return was all so sweet‚Äîand bittersweet too, as our farewell to our favorite grandad companion.
The Last of Us: Joel Saves Ellie Photo: Liane Hentscher/HBO The Last of Us‚Äô grim climax has been known to fans of the games for so long, the question for the HBO show wasn‚Äôt whether or not it would happen, but how it could match it‚Äîand it did so spectacularly well in Joel‚Äôs tense assault on the Firefly facility. Cold, action-packed, and gut-wrenching in all the right ways, it translated the drama of the games‚Äô final sequences perfectly.
Star Trek: Strange New Worlds: Boimler Meets Spock Image: Paramount+ They say never meet your heroes, and while Strange New Worlds‚Äô crossover episode with Lower Decks definitely got a lot of play out of just how alien Boimler and Mariner were to their predecessors aboard the Enterprise, their arrival was smartly leveraged by the show to do some great character work‚Äîespecially the case for Mr. Spock, as he tried to grapple with the man he was becoming in the wake of exploring his romantic desires for Nurse Chapel and his human side.
Ahsoka: Return to the Clone Wars Image: Lucasfilm It took a few episodes but, eventually, Ahsoka did something fans had long dreamed of: recreated scenes from the Clone Wars in live-action. The flashbacks helped give Ahsoka‚Äôs backstory much-needed context, and having Hayden Christensen there didn‚Äôt hurt either.
Scott Pilgrim Takes Off: The Movie Screenshot: Netflix Almost every single thing about Scott Pilgrim Takes Off is meta, but our favorite weird, meta moment is when the show makes a Scott Pilgrim movie, imagining the events of the original Scott Pilgrim comic and movie.
Star Trek: Picard: The Poker Game Image: Paramount+ No matter how it set out at first, there was perhaps no other way Star Trek: Picard could come to a final end. The day saved, the torched passed on to a new Next Generation, all that was left was for Jean-Luc and his old friends to celebrate closing one chapter of their lives, before heading apart from each other‚Äôs orbits again. And what else could they do, than play one last game of cards together? A wonderful good-bye indeed.
The Mandalorian: The New Republic Is Monstrous Image: Lucasfilm There‚Äôs a lot in The Mandalorian‚Äôs third season that doesn‚Äôt pan out‚Äîchalk it up to the fact that the show is always willing to conform to a comfortable status quo after gesturing at something fresh and exciting. And yet its examination of the New Republic through the eyes of political refugee Dr. Pershing is a truly rare and fascinating bit of critique, even before taking in the fact it‚Äôs a biting critique of the heroes of Star Wars‚Äô original trilogy. Alas, ‚ÄúThe Convert‚Äù couldn‚Äôt quite commit to its exploration of just how little the New Republic‚Äôs neoliberal engine differed from the bureaucracy of the Galactic Empire, pinning the true evils of its climactic torture of Dr. Pershing at the hands of Moff Gideon‚Äôs remnant agents. But for just a brief moment, The Mandalorian bared teeth as it‚Äôs never dared to before.
One Piece: Sanji‚Äôs Backstory Image: Netflix If you have friends who love the One Piece manga and anime, you‚Äôve probably been warned that our favorite crew all have quite tragic backstories. Even with that warning we were not prepared for the reveal of why Sanji and Zeff are so loyal to one another despite their tough-love relationship. We discover that the two survived a shipwreck and Zeff gave Sanji what he thought were scraps to survive on; the build to the reveal that the scraps were actually all they had and Zeff had to eat his leg was shocking and heartbreaking all at once. Even being told to brace ourselves, we were not prepared for that.
The Fall of the House of Usher: The Masque of the Red Death Photo: Eike Schroter/Netflix Episode two of Fall of the House of Usher really set the tone for the series‚Äô horror. Seeing the youngest Usher ignore safety protocols and decide to throw a rager in a dangerous, should-be-demolished warehouse‚Äîwhere his father‚Äôs company happens to be hiding dangerous, very illegal chemicals‚Äîwas so stressful until the final moments of the episode. The sheer tension leading to punishment in the form of grotesque chemical-rain violence was built to sky-high levels‚Ä¶ and it more than paid off in the carnage that followed.
Castlevania: Nocturne: ‚ÄúDivine Bloodlines‚Äù Screenshot: Netflix The first Netflix Castlevania show gave fans of the games everything they thought they wanted when season two climaxed with Trevor, Sypha, and Alucard storming Dracula‚Äôs castle set to the iconic game track ‚ÄúBloody Tears.‚Äù But spiritual successor Nocturne went one better in evoking the legendary gaming theme of its protagonist Richter, ‚ÄúDivine Bloodlines,‚Äù in a moment that wasn‚Äôt just incredible action, but a thoughtful connection to the generations of characters woven throughout Castlevania‚Äôs legacy.
Our Flag Means Death: Calypso‚Äôs Birthday Photo: Nicola Dove/Max The beauty our pirate crew experiences in this episode is purely joyous. The makeup, the costumes, and comedy felt Shakespearean in the best ways. And wasn‚Äôt Con O‚ÄôNeill as Izzy Hands utterly gorgeous as he performed ‚ÄúLa Vie en rose‚Äù?
Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch From Mercury: The Flash-Forward Ending Screenshot: Crunchyroll Witch From Mercury made the love of its protagonists‚Äîa heated topic of discussion throughout the show with the will-they/won‚Äôt-they of it all, especially when it comes to queer characters‚Äîa driving part of its final episode, leading to a flash-forward epilogue that confirmed everything fans of Suletta and Miorine always wanted: they were in love, they were married, and they were building a happy life together. It‚Äôs a shame Bandai tried to backtrack from it after the fact with cowardly acts of media censorship, but the company can‚Äôt hide what is right there in the show, no matter how hard it tries.
Poker Face: Charlie Figures It Out Screenshot: Peacock/YouTube This happens in each episode, and always in a unique way, but it‚Äôs incredibly fun every single time. And it‚Äôs not because Charlie is finally solving the murder mystery that particular episode; she, and the audience, almost always know who did it beforehand. It‚Äôs that she finally finds that one specific clue or link that explains the how and why, and oh how satisfying it is. We can‚Äôt pick just one Poker Face puzzle, so this is a nod to them all.
Mrs. Davis: The British Knights Image: Peacock Mrs. Davis was a weird, wonderful show filled with weird, wonderful moments. One that sticks out though is the mid-season reveal that the series‚Äô opening scene, which you assumed had actually happened, was in fact an elaborate Super Bowl commercial for the British Knights sneaker company featuring the Holy Grail. Like we said, it‚Äôs a wild show.
Star Trek: Lower Decks: Mariner and Sito Image: Paramount+ For four seasons, we‚Äôve wondered what Beckett Mariner‚Äôs deal was‚Äîher anti-authority persona masking what was deep down her innate desire to be the best she could in Starfleet, and her capability to be a great leader always clashing with her sense of self-sabotage. But in a touching moment that called back to the original The Next Generation episode the show takes its name from beautifully, we learned just why Mariner has always been fearful of the career laid out ahead of her‚Äîin a nuanced reckoning with the specters of DS9‚Äôs Dominion War in a way few contemporary Trek shows have actually tried to tackle before.
For All Mankind: The End of ‚ÄúCrossing the Line‚Äù Photo from episode five, for extra spoiler protection. The fourth season of For All Mankind is still in progress as you read this‚Äîso in this one instance, we‚Äôre going to tread carefully. But let‚Äôs just say the end of episode seven, ‚ÄúCrossing the Line,‚Äù which debuts December 22, features two of the show‚Äôs titans facing off, one of them asking one of the most ridiculous, amazing questions ever, and then the show dropping a mega-hit hip hop track over the end credits. We jumped up and cheered.
Scott Pilgrim Takes Off: Scott‚Äôs ‚ÄúDeath‚Äù Image: Netflix The first episode of Science Saru and Netflix‚Äôs Scott Pilgrim anime feels off. Its beat-for-beat recreation of the opening parts of the film and the classic comic series almost feel too beat-for-beat. Is that really all it will be? Turns out, in a sudden poof of loonies and toonies as Scott falls in his fight with Matthew Patel at the end of the episode, we were about to get anything but‚Äîand that was a perfect surprise.
Silo: The Final Reveal Image: Apple TV+ All through season one of Silo there‚Äôs a massive question hanging over everything: what‚Äôs outside the Silo? Is the world over, as everyone believes? Or have the characters actually been trapped under mysterious circumstances? The answer, it turns out, is kind of in the middle. In the final shot of the season, we learn the world is in fact over, but that there are many, many more silos.
Ahsoka: Ezra Comes Home Image: Lucasfilm Ezra‚Äôs initial return in Ahsoka was a somewhat muted affair, as Sabine and Ahsoka grappled with the strange new galaxy they found themselves in in their quest to find him and Thrawn alike. But the show saved the emotional Rebels reunion for its final moments, when Ezra, after years and years away, made his way back to his home, and to the New Republic‚Ä¶ where a tearful Hera was waiting for him.
Star Trek: Strange New Worlds: ‚ÄúSubspace Rhapsody‚Äù‚Äôs Grand Finale
Star Trek: Strange New Worlds | We Are One (Full Performance) | Paramount+ It‚Äôs remarkable enough alone that Strange New Worlds managed to pull together a musical episode, let one as filled with both great ditties and excellent character work to put a Trek spin on the high camp as what we got. But nothing in the episode quite beats the all singing, all dancing jazz hands of the climactic ensemble song ‚ÄúWe Are One.‚Äù It‚Äôs goofy, it‚Äôs endearing, it wraps everything up in a neat musical bow‚Äîeven as the characters involved are barrelling ahead on trajectories that are anything but neat‚Äîand it‚Äôs got Klingons having a boy band K-Pop moment. Delightful.
Doctor Who: The Doctor Bi-Generates
The Fourteenth Doctor Bi-generates! | David Tennant to Ncuti Gatwa | The Giggle | Doctor Who Just‚Ä¶ push! In one magical moment, Doctor Who did the unthinkable: gave its hero a chance to have it both ways, literally. Succumbing to a mortal wound from the villainous Toymaker, David Tennant‚Äôs 14th Doctor prepared to bid farewell‚Ä¶ only to find his future self literally splitting off from him, giving us two Doctors, and a chase for the physician to heal thyself quite literally: a bit of Time Lord rehab out of order, as Ncuti Gatwa‚Äôs immediately charming 15th Doctor gives his past self the push to reflect, pause, and rest‚Ä¶ if only so he can race out and begin his own adventures.
The Last of Us: ‚ÄúLong, Long Time‚Äù Photo: Liane Hentscher/HBO
On a list of memorable moments, it‚Äôs unorthodox to put a full episode, but we had to make an exception. Everything about this touching love story, sandwiched in the middle of a zombie show, was perfect. It was the moment everyone knew The Last of Us was something special.
